Name: 40_heat_lens_collector_light
Representative_Docs:
"Solar Energy Collection Methods and Apparatus with Light Concentrating Lens"

This topic encompasses various techniques and devices related to solar energy collection, utilizing a light concentrating lens. These methods involve the use of a light receiving surface, an opposite light exiting surface, and a curved shape configured to direct light passing through the lens, ultimately absorbing thermal energy from the solar energy. The energy collection process also includes a concentrator apparatus with a conduit and an energy absorbing medium, converting the solar energy into thermal energy.

This topic is about methods and technologies related to solar energy collection. The focus is on energy collection including collection apparatus with a light concentrating lens, which is designed to receive and focus sunlight onto a light receiving surface. The light exiting surface of the lens is opposite to the light receiving surface and includes a curved shape that is configured to direct light passing through the lens and towards the energy collecting surface. The energy collection process also involves a concentrator apparatus with a conduit and an energy absorbing medium, which converts the collected solar energy into thermal energy.

"Solar Energy Collection System and Methods with a Light Concentrating Lens"

This topic encompasses various aspects of solar energy collection systems that utilize a light concentrating lens. The system includes a collection apparatus with a light receiving surface, an energy absorbing medium conduit, and a curved shape configured to direct light passing through the focal point of the lens. The light exiting the surface of the lens is opposite to the light receiving surface and includes a curved shape. The energy collection process also involves a concentrator apparatus with a conductive medium that converts solar energy into thermal energy.

Name: 44_zinc_tin_truss_thermoelectric
Representative_Docs: The topic is about the manufacturing method of hot-dip aluminum zinc zinc aluminum magnesium composite steel, focusing on its yield strength and MPa grade. The steel plate contains specific components such as Si, Mn, Cr, Ti, Nb, Fe, and impurities. The conditions that need to be satisfied during the manufacturing process include time, CMn, mnS, and the presence of Ti, Nb, and NbCN. The yield strength and tensile strength of the hot-dip aluminum zinc zinc aluminum magnesium steel plate are good, and it has excellent corrosion resistance. The production method is low-cost and high-yield, making it commonly used in various industries like steel structure buildings, roofs, wall surfaces, and household appliances, as well as in the production of photovoltaics.

This topic describes a research area focused on the development of optoelectronically dynamic elements, which are windows films or lenses that can be used in flatpanel displays, photovoltaics, and glass doors. These elements are based on polymer-based electronics and are made using nonaqueous zinc-based electrolytes. The electrodeposition process is reversible, allowing for the deposition of layers of zinc on a transparent working electrode, which can rapidly form an opaque zinc-containing coating. The topic also covers the use of xray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy for analysis, as well as the application of suitable voltage to facilitate the transitioning of the opaque zinc-containing coating to a transparent state. The methods for making these elements using nonaqueous zinc-based electrolytes are also described.

This topic describes a research area related to optoelectronically dynamic elements, which are made up of nonaqueous zinc-based electrolytes and can reversibly deposit layers of zinc. These elements are used in various applications such as windows films, lenses, flat panel displays, and photovoltaics. The electrolytes are analyzed using Xray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy, and are found to facilitate the reversible zinc electrodeposition process. The elements are also designed with a transparent working electrode and a counter electrode to enable efficient depositing of layers of zinc. The research also covers the use of nonaqueous zinc-based electrolytes in the development of transparent, opaque coatings that can be used on working electrodes to rapidly transition between a transparent and an opaque state, as well as methods for making these elements using disclosed nonaqueous zinc-based electrolytes.

The tile also has a rear face that connects walls, and a face opposite the rear face. The invention provides access to the ambient environment through a cavity in the upper face, and has an opening area on the lower face for waste heat utilization.

Name: 46_sequestration_geothermal_lubricant_drilling

The focus is on sedimentary rocks and basement granite, with the consideration of horizontal and vertical wells.

Name: 47_copolymer_synthesis_copolymers_pathways

Name: 62_photocatalyst_photocatalytic_grass_nanosheet
Representative_Docs: This topic describes an invention related to a photocatalytic fuel cell for treating azo dye wastewater. The invention involves using a bismuth vanadate nanosheet array on a transparent conductive glass substrate as the photoanode, and a poly hexyl thiophene organic semiconductor film on the same substrate as the photocathode. The lower Fermi level position and wider band gap nanosheet structure of the bismuth vanadate nanosheet array ensure a stronger reactivity and better light trapping capacity, which improves the contact area with dye molecules in the organic wastewater solution. The higher Fermi level position and narrower band gap combination of the poly hexyl thiophene photocathode promotes carrier separation and ensures sufficient redox capacity, leading to high-efficiency azo dye degradation reactions and the realization of high-efficiency solar energy, chemical energy, and electric energy conversion.

Name: 65_module_frequency_modules_modulation
Representative_Docs: This topic describes an invention related to the setting method of frequency modulation parameters in a wind-solar energy storage station group, taking into consideration dynamic regulation constraints. The method comprises several steps, such as constructing an offline fault set, updating station set parameters according to off-network and/or communication interruption conditions, triggering parameter setting operations based on time events, constructing a dynamic setting model for frequency modulation parameters, and solving the problem of station frequency modulation function and/or fault ride-through state inertia time constant differential modulation rate active amplitude limitation according to preset delay optimization. The method utilizes various power supply reserve resources and improves the frequency stability supporting capability of the wind-light storage station group, ensuring the frequency power grid operates within a reasonable range.

This topic pertains to the method of setting frequency modulation parameters in a wind solar energy storage station group, considering dynamic regulation constraints. The method involves constructing an offline fault set, obtaining the maximum frequency change rate and maximum frequency deviation, discount coefficient, response deviation area, updating station set parameters according to offline and/or communication interruption conditions, triggering parameter setting operation according to time events using a hybrid driving mechanism, constructing a dynamic setting model for frequency modulation parameters, solving the problem of station frequency modulation function and/or fault ride-through state inertia time constant, differential modulation rate, active amplitude limitation, and other advantages of various power supplies reserve resources, improving the frequency stability supporting capability of the wind-light storage station group, and ensuring the frequency power grid is within a reasonable range.

The method utilizes various power supply reserve resources and improves the frequency stability supporting capability of the wind-light storage station group, ensuring the frequency power grid is within a reasonable range.

Name: 66_damper_marine_ocean_carbon
Representative_Docs: The topic describes an invention related to the process of capturing, storing and utilizing carbon in the ocean. It involves the use of a process apparatus that utilizes natural seawater and Direct Air Capture (DAC) technology to capture carbon dioxide from flue gas discharged by marine facilities, coastal power plants and marine ships. The captured carbon is then stored in the ocean in a column of low head, large water flow, which is used to save energy and comply with environmental regulations. The invention provides an affordable and effective means of using marine ecosystems as carbon sinks and reservoirs, and helps to address the issue of climate change.

The topic is related to the field of Ocean Carbon Capture and Storage (OCCS), which involves the use of various methods to capture and store carbon dioxide from flue gas discharged by marine facilities, such as coastal power plants and ships. The process apparatus used in this topic involves the direct air capture of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere using natural engineering methods, such as natural seawater washing and dissolving gas carbon capture. The captured carbon dioxide is then stored in the ocean in natural seawater, which is neutralized using bicarbonate to form a carbonate solution. This method is intended to provide an affordable and effective means of using marine ecosystems as carbon sinks and reservoirs, and can help to respond to climate change. The topic also covers the use of ocean storage water columns with low head and large water flow to save energy and comply with environmental regulations, as well as the discharge of water that complies with these regulations.

The topic describes an invention related to ocean carbon capture, storage, and utilization. It involves a process apparatus that utilizes fossil energy and natural seawater to capture and store carbon dioxide from flue gas discharged by marine facilities, coastal power plants, and marine ships. The process also includes the use of direct air capture technology, natural engineering methods, and low-head large water flow technology to save energy and comply with environmental regulations. The captured carbon is then neutralized using bicarbonate and stored in the ocean in a column of water. This invention provides an affordable, green, and effective means of using marine ecosystems as carbon sinks and reservoirs, and responding to climate change.

Name: 67_sewage_treatment_biochemical_water
Representative_Docs: This topic description is about a utility model for an integrated sewage treatment equipment based on solar energy. The equipment comprises a treatment box body with a biochemical stirring tank, filtering tank, and reciprocating transmission mechanism. The biochemical stirring tank has guide plates arranged on its inner wall, and the guide plates are pushed by guide frames to drive a reciprocating swing mechanism. This mechanism allows the sewage to be swung between different areas of the biochemical stirring tank for efficient treatment. The treatment box body is fully mixed sewage reagents, which are uniformly mixed to improve the treatment efficiency. The utility model is designed to disclose an innovative solution for integrated sewage treatment using solar energy.

This topic description is about a method of solar intelligent biochemical sewage treatment. The invention relates to the technical field of sewage treatment and particularly focuses on using solar energy to heat and mix the sewage, as well as using an intelligent controller to regulate the temperature and degradation rate of pollutants. The solar intelligent biochemical sewage treatment equipment includes a heat collecting pipe, a hot water tank, a biochemical reaction tank, and an air aeration pipe. The problem of alpine regions with low temperatures is solved by using solar panels and wind wheel engines to provide integrated supply power efficiency, utilizing green energy. The solar energy stored in existing sewage treatment technology is utilized to improve the efficiency and reduce the cost of low-carbon energy saving.

This topic refers to the invention of a new device that combines a sewage heat pump and solar energy to provide a more efficient and sustainable heating solution for sewage treatment processes. The device comprises various components such as solar hot water circulation, aeration, biochemical tank, refrigerant circulation, and heat exchanger assembly. The heat exchanger assembly uses high-temperature and high-pressure gaseous refrigerant to exchange heat between the solar water and the sewage aeration tank, while the compressor assembly continuously circulates the refrigerant to maintain the temperature. By using this innovative technology, the device is able to efficiently obtain heat from the solar energy source, significantly reducing the energy consumption of sewage heating and increasing its use value.

The process also involves utilizing nonoptical energy, electric energy, and hydrogen energy to effectively prepare starch inside the microbial cells. Additionally, the topic includes the construction of recombinant microorganisms for the preparation of starch using carbon dioxide.

The method involves providing energy-rich microbial cells, which are based on nonoptical energy generation, to utilize glucosephosphate adenylyltransferase and starch synthase to effectively prepare starch inside the microbial cells. The process also involves fixing carbon dioxide to produce starch.

The method is a process of preparing starch using a recombinant microorganism that utilizes nonoptical energy, hydrogen energy, and carbon dioxide to effectively prepare starch inside microbial cells.

Name: 72_dust_hydrosolar_removal_distillate
Representative_Docs: This topic description is about a device for detecting vehicle running parameters using a laser sensor. The device comprises a detection device body with a dust removal assembly, which includes a connecting ring, protective cover, and dust removal brush. The detection device body utilizes laser sensor technology to detect vehicle running parameters, and the energy supply assembly absorbs solar energy and converts it into electric energy for energy saving. The dust removal assembly is used to remove dust from the detection device body, ensuring that the sensor head is protected from dust and shelter. The device is designed to improve the precision of sensor detection and to avoid problems related to dust and rainwater affecting the sensor's performance.

Name: 73_adhesive_battery_strings_pieces
Representative_Docs: This topic pertains to the manufacturing method of photovoltaic modules, specifically focusing on the encapsulation of photovoltaic cells. The modules consist of multiple cell strings, with each cell string being encapsulated by two adhesive films. The central and peripheral regions of the module also receive encapsulation by adhesive films. The photovoltaic module includes holes, which are filled with a filling structure made of a material that has a faster crosslinking and curing speed compared to the material used for encapsulating the adhesive film. The second hole is defined in the peripheral region and is aligned with the corresponding second hole in the central region, allowing for efficient material distribution.

This topic pertains to the manufacturing of photovoltaic modules, specifically focusing on the method of manufacturing photovoltaic modules. It encompasses the use of various materials and techniques, such as adhesive films and crosslinking curing speeds, to create a functional and efficient photovoltaic module. The module consists of multiple cell strings, with each cell string having a central region and a peripheral region. The central region is encapsulated by a first adhesive film, while the peripheral region is encapsulated by a second adhesive film. The module also includes second encapsulating adhesive films, defining holes, and hole-filled structures. The second hole is aligned with the corresponding second hole, and the material used for encapsulating the adhesive film has a faster crosslinking and curing speed.

The topic is related to the manufacturing of photovoltaic modules, specifically focusing on the disclosure of methods for producing a photovoltaic module using a method that involves the use of adhesive films and cell strings. The photovoltaic module includes a central region and peripheral region, with the central region having a hole that is aligned with a corresponding hole in the peripheral region. The module also includes multiple cell strings encapsulated by adhesive films, with each cell string having a second encapsulating adhesive film stacked with a gap encapsulating adhesive film. The process involves filling the holes with a material that has a faster crosslinking and curing speed, allowing for efficient encapsulation of the cell strings.

Name: 75_tower_coatings_kerosene_dismantling
Representative_Docs: The topic describes a method for constructing and dismantling wind energy tower towers, specifically focusing on the particular tower wind energy plant. Name: 76_function_objective_comprehensive_scheduling
Representative_Docs: This topic pertains to the invention of a comprehensive energy optimal scheduling method that provides an optimized dispatching method. The method comprises several components, such as wind energy, light energy, hydrogen energy, and more. It involves acquiring data on electricity and hydrogen prices, wind power, photovoltaic power, edge distribution function, load preset time period, historical data, and dynamic changes in unit electricity consumption and resources. The method also includes adjusting predicted values based on these parameters and obtaining load values through demand response based on electricity prices. It aims to reduce peak-valley differences in load and acquiring target functions, as well as operation consumption resources. The weighted summation objective function and second objective function are used to obtain the total objective function, which is then solved to obtain an optimized dispatching result. The method also introduces a demand response strategy that considers correlations between electricity and hydrogen prices, effectively improving economic efficiency.

Name: 79_seal_elevator_rotatable_equipment

The seal body is fastened at one end and extends elongate manner, with the second end being configured in an annular manner to surround the rotatable shaft. Name: 80_membrane_robustness_multieffect_dispersion
Representative_Docs: This topic describes a preparation method for a hydrophobic modified membrane based on a multi-effect heat energy conversion process. The method involves dispersing surfacecarboxylated carbon nanotubes in a solvent, applying the dispersion on a PVDF membrane, drying the membrane, and subjecting it to mechanical hot pressing to form a high-robustness functional membrane. The functional membrane is then placed in an alkane solution containing a silane coupling agent, which is removed after drying. The resulting membrane can be used for multieffect heat energy conversion, reducing evaporation and landfill leachate. The invention aims to develop a sustainable solar energy path through a rational, feasible, efficient, and technical process using current membrane concentrated solution reduction.

The topic describes a preparation method for a hydrophobic modified membrane based on a conversion of thermal energy through multiple effects, which can be used for solar heat conversion and electroinduced joule heat effect. The process involves dispersing surfacecarboxylated carbon nanotubes in a solvent, forming a dispersion, applying it to a PVDF membrane, drying the membrane, and subjecting it to mechanical hot pressing to form a high-robustness functional membrane. The functional membrane is then placed in an alkane solution containing a silane coupling agent, which is removed after drying, and the high-robustness functional membrane is formed. The present invention aims to develop a multieffect heat energy conversion based solar heat conversion, which achieves process evaporation reduction and landfill leachate membrane concentrated solution driven green sustainable solar energy. The method is rational, feasible, efficient, and technical, and can provide a technical path for reducing current membrane concentrated solution.

This topic refers to the preparation method of a hydrophobic modified membrane based on multi-effect heat energy conversion, which involves dispersing surfacecarboxylated carbon nanotubes in a solvent, applying the dispersion on a PVDF membrane, drying the membrane, and subjecting it to mechanical hot pressing to form a high-robustness functional membrane. The high-robustness functional membrane is then placed in an alkane solution containing a silane coupling agent and is removed after drying. The present invention aims to develop a multieffect heat energy conversion based solar heat conversion electroinduced joule heat effect, which achieves process evaporation reduction and landfill leachate membrane concentrated solution driven green sustainable solar energy provides a rational, feasible, efficient, and technical path. The current membrane concentrated solution reduction is also discussed.

Name: 81_altitude_high_hydrogenation_catalyst
Representative_Docs: This topic describes an invention for an array-type high-altitude wind power system. The system comprises multiple high-altitude wind power generators arranged in an array manner, along with an intelligent control unit. The high-altitude wind generating set includes an airship as a high-altitude floating platform, with a wind channel and a fixed airship mooring rope. The system also includes a high-altitude wind-driven generator and an inertial navigation module for global navigation and positioning. The communication connection and the intelligent control unit allow for efficient wind energy acquisition and power generation.

This topic is about a novel array-type high-altitude wind power generation system. It comprises multiple high-altitude wind power generators arranged in an array manner, an intelligent control unit, and a high-altitude floating platform with a wind channel. The system also includes an airship-based high-altitude floating platform wind channel, a high-altitude wind generator, a fixed airship mooring rope wind channel, and a high-altitude wind-driven generator. The system is designed for efficient wind energy acquisition and power generation.

This topic pertains to an invention that belongs to the technical field of high-altitude wind energy engines. The technical proposal involves the use of an escalator-type high-altitude wind energy engine device and its method. The lifting frame is hung at a high altitude, and the kite operation platform is connected by a lifting rope. The positioning rope heights and driving wheel positions are carefully adjusted, resulting in the upper rotating wheel being higher than the lower rotating wheel. This design provides benefits in high-altitude kite operation and stress area reduction. The invention aims to fully utilize high-altitude wind energy and generate high-speed rotary power, continuously transmitted through the engine, resulting in increased wind energy conversion efficiency.

Name: 82_display_available_requirement_determines
Representative_Docs: This topic pertains to the development of a solar-powered vehicle topper unit, which includes a solar powered display assembly and related systems, methods, and controllers. The unit is designed to harness solar energy and use it to power an electronic display housing, which can be interposed between the display assembly and the housing to provide an alternative power source. The controller determines the power requirements of the operating display assembly and determines the power available from the solar energy harvesting device. The power available from the solar energy harvesting device is then used to meet or exceed the power requirement, and if necessary, the controller sources supplemental power from operational power sources or alternative power sources.

This topic pertains to the development of a solar-powered vehicle topper unit, which includes a solar powered display assembly and related systems, methods, and controller. The unit is designed to harness and utilize solar energy to power an alternative power source for the display assembly, which can be interposed between the electronic display housing and the external electrically connected display assembly housing. The controller determines the power requirement of the operating display assembly and determines the power available from the solar energy harvesting device. The solar energy harvesting device powers the display assembly when the power available meets or exceeds the power requirement, and if the power available falls below the power requirement, the controller sources supplemental power from operational power sources or alternative power sources.

This topic pertains to the development of a solar-powered vehicle topper unit, which includes a solar powered display assembly and related systems, methods, and controllers. The unit utilizes an electronic display housing, an alternative power source, and a solar energy harvesting device. The controller determines the power requirement of the operating display assembly and determines the power available from the solar energy harvesting device. The solar energy harvesting device meets or exceeds the power requirement, and the controller sources power available from operational power sources, supplemental power, or an alternative power source.

Name: 83_tilt_sunshade_precipitation_biaxial
Representative_Docs:
"Sunshade Solar Power: A Eco-friendly and Convenient Solution for Harnessing Solar Energy"

This topic describes a new innovation that combines traditional sunshades and solar panels to provide a sustainable and convenient solution for charging electronic devices. The sunshade solar power system integrates solar panels that collect and store energy in a rechargeable battery, allowing users to charge their devices placed at charging ports with smart features like charge sensors and controllers. The system is designed to be highly efficient, particularly in weather conditions that affect solar panel output. The flexible solar panels can be folded and stowed for practicality and ease of use. Additionally, the system includes detachable solar panels for attachment and flexibility. Overall, sunshade solar power offers a convenient and eco-friendly way to harness solar energy for various outdoor activities.

"Sunshade Solar Power: A Eco-Friendly and Convenient Way to Harness Solar Energy"

This topic describes a new innovative product that integrates solar panels into traditional sunshades such as umbrellas and gazebos. The system allows users to collect solar energy and store it in a rechargeable battery, providing a convenient way to charge electronic devices. The smart features of the system include charge sensors and controllers that optimize energy usage, making it highly efficient. The flexible solar panels can be folded and stowed for ease of use, and the detachable solar panel attachment provides flexibility in different sunshade types. Overall, this technology provides a sustainable and practical solution for harnessing solar energy in various outdoor activities.

"Sunshade Solar Power: Harnessing Solar Energy for Convenient and Eco-Friendly Outdoor Activities"

Sunshade solar power enhances traditional sunshades, umbrellas, and gazebos by integrating solar panels that collect and store solar energy in a rechargeable battery. This allows users to charge electronic devices and use smart features like charge sensors and controllers to optimize energy usage. The flexible solar panels can be folded and stowed for ease of use, and detachable solar panels can be attached for different sunshade types. Overall, sunshade solar power provides a convenient and eco-friendly way to harness solar energy for various outdoor activities.

Name: 84_box_storage_motor_bag
Representative_Docs: This topic pertains to the field of solar energy storage, specifically focusing on a new and efficient light-following collecting energy storage device invention. The invention relates to a device that comprises a base with a fixed ground end, a fixed upper end surface, and a fixed quaternary motor inside a sun motor bin that is rotatably arranged at the upper end surface. The device also includes a fixed output shaft quaternary motor, a transversely fixed sun motor connecting rods, symmetrically rotatably arranged sides, and a sun motor bin driven by the sun motor. The invention further includes a fixed end connecting rods, a far away sun motor bin support plate, and a close connecting rods fixed unfolding motor controller energy storage battery arranged base acquisition assembly rotationally arranged supporting plate connected output shaft unfolding motor.

This topic describes an innovative device for efficient solar energy storage and collection, specifically focusing on a solar new energy efficient light-following collecting energystoring device. It involves a fixed base with a fixed upper end surface and a quaternary motor located inside the sun motor bin, which rotatably arranges on the upper end surface. The device also comprises a fixed output shaft quaternary motor, symmetrically rotatably arranged sides, and sun motor bin driven sun motor support plate fixed end connecting rods far away sun motor bin support plate close connecting rods fixed unfolding motor controller energy storage battery arranged base acquisition assembly rotationally arranged supporting plate connected output shaft unfolding motor. This invention is related to the technical field of solar energy storage.

This topic describes an invention related to solar energy storage. It involves a device that is efficient in collecting and storing energy from the sun. The device consists of a base with a fixed upper end surface and a quaternary motor that is rotatably arranged on the upper end surface. The device also comprises a fixed output shaft, a quaternary motor, transversely fixed sun motor connecting rods, symmetrically rotatably arranged sides, and a sun motor bin that is driven by the sun motor. The device also includes a fixed end connecting rods, a far away sun motor bin support plate, and a fixed unfolding motor controller. The energy storage battery is arranged on the base and acquisition assembly is rotationally arranged supporting plate connected output shaft.

Name: 85_wind_driving_base_tower
Representative_Docs: The topic is about the invention of a solar and wind power complementary generating device that combines solar energy and wind power to generate electricity. The device consists of a solar driving module, a wind power driving module, and a linked driving shaft generator. The solar driving module converts sunlight into electric energy, while the wind power driving module drives the generator to generate electricity. The device also includes multiple solar panels, arranged alternately and connected to the solar driving module and wind power driving module. The solar panels and wind blades rotate to convert sunlight and wind energy into electricity, while the hollowed-out parts and drive motor rotate to generate electricity. This technology aims to improve the efficiency of traditional solar energy and wind power plants, overcome the challenges of easy shade, and make it easier to apply to agriculture and cultivation like waste land resources.

The topic is about the invention of a solar-wind power complementary generating device that combines solar energy and wind power to generate electricity. The device consists of a solar driving module, a wind power driving module, and a linked driving shaft generator. The solar driving module converts sunlight into electric energy, while the wind power driving module drives the generator to generate electricity. The device also includes hollowed-out parts and solar panels arranged alternately to optimize energy conversion. The solar panels can rotate and are connected to the driving shaft, which rotates the generator to generate electricity. This technology has the potential to improve traditional solar energy and wind power plants by reducing shade, improving ground space utilization, and reducing the difficulty of applying agriculture on difficult-to-plant land resources.

This topic describes an invention that combines solar energy and wind power to generate electricity. The device consists of a solar driving module, a wind power driving module, and a linked driving shaft generator. The solar driving module converts sunlight into electric energy, which is then converted into electricity by the wind power driving module and the drive generator. The device also includes hollowed-out parts and solar panels, which are arranged alternately and connected to the solar driving module. The solar panels are used to convert sunlight into electric energy, which is then used to drive the drive motor and generate electricity. The wind blades are also used to rotate the generator and generate electricity. This invention aims to improve the efficiency of traditional solar energy and wind power plants by reducing the amount of shade and improving the application of agriculture on difficult-to-apply land resources.

Name: 86_silo_blocks_granular_electricity
Representative_Docs: The topic is about the Green Steam Industrial Steam Generator process, which involves the use of silo heaters, material transfer heat exchangers, and renewable energy sources such as solar and wind energy. The process includes the transfer of granular material from an upper portion silo to a lower portion silo, which is then heated by an operating heater to generate renewable energy. The silo is designed to receive the granular material and transfer it to the heat exchanger for efficient heat generation.

The topic is about the process of steam generation in industrial green steam generators, which use a silo-based system. The steam generator includes a silo heater, material transfer heat exchanger, and a silo configured to receive granular material. The upper portion of the silo heater is arranged to receive granular material, which is then transferred and heated in the heat exchanger. The heat generated from the steam exchanger is then used to power electricity operating heaters, which can be sourced from renewable energy sources such as solar or wind energy. The lower portion of the silo is arranged to contact granular material flowing downward inside the silo, allowing for efficient heat transfer.

The topic is about the process of steam generation in industrial green steam generators, which involve the use of silo heaters, material transfer, and heat exchangers. The silo heaters are made of materials that can transfer heat effectively, and are arranged in the upper portion of the silo. The granular material is received in the silo and heats up due to the contact with the upper portion silo heater. The heated material is then transferred to the heat exchanger, where the heat is used to generate renewable energy sources such as solar or wind energy. The steam exchanger is designed to dispose of the granular material exiting the silo, while the lower portion of the silo is arranged to receive the flowing downward granular material. The electricity operating heater is used to generate renewable energy sources, which can be solar or wind energy.

Name: 87_busbar_fingers_multiple_electrodes
Representative_Docs: The topic is related to the technical field of photovoltaics and involves the design and application of solar cell photovoltaic modules. The module comprises multiple electrodes, multiple second electrodes, a staggered interdigitated pattern, and multiple fingers. The multiple electrodes and fingers are connected through a busbar, which consists of multiple fingers and second busbars. The second busbar has second welding points defined, and the solar cell includes multiple insulation structures configured to cover the area. The busbar is located at one end, and the second busbar is located at the other end. The multiple fingers close the second busbar and/or ends, and the second welding points defined second busbar and/or window opened projection second busbar avoids short circuits.

The topic is about the technical field of photovoltaics, specifically focusing on solar cell photovoltaic modules. The module is related to the surface of the solar cell and consists of multiple electrodes, including multiple second electrodes, a staggered interdigitated pattern, and multiple fingers. The multiple electrodes and fingers are connected through a busbar, which is also made up of multiple fingers and second busbars. The second busbar is connected to a second welding point, and the solar cell includes multiple insulation structures configured to cover the area. The busbar is located at the end of the second busbar, and multiple fingers close the second busbar and/or ends. The second welding point is defined, and the insulation structures and/or window opened projection are also defined to avoid short circuits in the solar cell.

The topic is about the technical field of photovoltaics, specifically focusing on solar cell photovoltaic modules. The module has multiple electrodes, multiple second electrodes, a staggered interdigitated pattern, and multiple fingers. The module also includes a busbar with multiple fingers, second electrodes, and second busbars. The multiple insulation structures cover the area and are located at the ends of the busbar and second busbar. The second busbar has second welding points defined, and the solar cell includes multiple second fingers close to the busbar window. The projection busbar has a welding point, and the respective insulation structure and/or window opened projection second busbar have second welding points. This design avoids short circuits in the solar cell.

Name: 88_ring_stationary_die_stirling
Representative_Docs: The topic described is related to the manufacturing method of hydropower energy, specifically focusing on the stationary and rotating ring structures used in the process. The stationary ring structure consists of a stationary ring base, a stationary ring backing, and a bearing mechanism configured to support the rotating ring structure relative to the stationary ring structure. The rotating ring structure includes a rotating ring base, a blade support ring, and a fluid flow stacked configuration. The topic also encompasses the disclosure of various components and their functions in the hydropower energy manufacturing process.

The topic is related to the manufacturing method of hydropower energy, specifically focusing on the design and components of a stationary ring structure. This structure includes a rotating ring base, a stationary ring base, a blade support ring, and a bearing mechanism for supporting the rotating ring structure relative to the stationary ring structure. The stationary ring base is configured to rotate around a rotational axis, while the rotating ring base is designed to rotate and has a fluid flow stacked configuration for generating hydropower energy. Additionally, the topic includes configurations for compression support and blade support ring, which are important for the structural stability and performance of the system.

The topic is related to the manufacturing method of hydropower energy, specifically focusing on the design and components of a stationary ring structure. This structure includes a rotating ring base, a stationary ring base, a blade support ring, and a bearing mechanism for supporting the rotating ring structure relative to the stationary ring structure. The stationary ring base is configured to rotate around a rotational axis, while the rotating ring base is designed to rotate and has a fluid flow stacked configuration. The topic also covers the use of compression support and fluid flow stacked configuration for the stationary ring backing.

Name: 89_injection_subterranean_formation_fluid
Representative_Docs: The topic is about a method for harvesting geothermal energy from subterranean formations using injection wellbores. The method involves providing injection wellbores that extend into the subterranean formation, positioning them selectively, and opening sleeves to enhance fluid pathways. The resulting fluid injection wellbore temperature is higher than the second temperature, and the method can produce fluid at the predetermined location. The process can also involve fracturing the subterranean formation at multiple locations proximate to the injection wellbores.

This topic describes a method for harvesting geothermal energy from a subterranean formation through a process of drilling injection wellbores and fracturing the formation to stimulate fluid production. This method involves positioning multiple injection wellbores and selectively opening sleeves to enhance fluid pathway and produce a fluid-rich injection wellbore. The temperature of the fluid produced can be higher than the second temperature, and the method can be used to extract geothermal energy from the subterranean formation.

The topic is about a method for harvesting geothermal energy from subterranean formations using injection wellbores. The method involves providing injection wellbores that extend into the subterranean formation, positioning them selectively, and opening sleeves to enhance fluid pathways. The produced fluid is then injected into the wellbore at a higher temperature than the second temperature, which helps to enhance the fluid's ability to produce more geothermal energy. The method also includes fracturing the subterranean formation at predetermined locations to allow for better fluid injection and production.

Name: 90_conduit_hydrogen_stages_waterguide
Representative_Docs: This topic describes a pumped-storage hydropower generation tower that employs conduit turbines with multiple stages. The tower consists of a pump disposed in a lower reservoir, which fills a water guide pipe channel connected to an upper reservoir through an inlet waterguide conduit. The water guide pipe channel has a helical sloping channel that extends from the lower to the upper reservoir. The flow rate of water is regulated by the pump and passes through conduit turbines, which are connected to a driving shaft that rotates freely. The conduit support bodies are installed to rotate freely, supporting the driving shaft. The arms of the conduit support bodies extend into the inner surface of the conduit, and a propeller fixed to the driving shaft is used to generate electricity. Multiple stages of conduit turbine units are disposed in the water guide pipe channel to increase the efficiency of the power generation.

The topic is about a pumped-storage hydropower generation tower that employs conduit turbines with multiple stages. The tower consists of a pump disposed in a lower reservoir, which fills the upper reservoir through a waterguide pipe channel connected to the surface of the upper reservoir. The helical sloping channel allows for a flow rate increase and power generation. The conduit turbine unit comprises driving shaft, extending center conduit, and flow rate passes through conduit support bodies that are installed rotate freely, supporting the driving shaft. The conduit support bodies have arms extending inner surface conduit, a fixed driving shaft, and rotate movement, allowing for a flow rate increase generator. Multiple stages of the tower are disposed, each with its own set of conduit turbine units.

The topic is about a pumped-storage hydropower generation tower that employs conduit turbines with multiple stages. The tower consists of a pump disposed in a pumping-up pipe that fills the lower and upper reservoirs through a waterguide pipe channel. The waterguide pipe channel has an inlet waterguide conduit connected to the surface of the upper reservoir, which extends down to the lower reservoir. The helical sloping channel allows for the flow of water with a higher flow rate. Power generation passes through the conduit turbine unit, which comprises a driving shaft extending from the center of the conduit, and support bodies installed on the inner surface of the conduit that rotate freely, supporting the driving shaft. The conduit support bodies have arms extending inner surface conduit, and a fixed driving shaft. The rotated movement of the support bodies generates a flow rate, which generates electricity in the conduit turbine units disposed multiple stages.

Name: 91_gearwheel_operatively_propeller_gear
Representative_Docs: The topic is related to the operating method of a universal propeller, which utilizes a novel gearwheel arranged rotor blade that is directly operatively connected to a reference gearwheel. The timing gear and operatively connected hub gear senses the processes of angular velocity, and the rotational movement of the hub follows the angular velocity of the reference gearwheel. The invention is particularly suitable for use in wind power installations, hydropower installations, engine ships, and aircraft.

The topic is related to the operating method of a universal propeller, which utilizes a novel gearwheel arranged rotor blade that is directly operatively connected to a reference gearwheel. The timing gear and operatively connected hub gear senses the processes of angular velocity, and the rotational movement of the hub follows the angular velocity of the reference gearwheel. The invention is particularly suitable for use in wind power installations, hydropower installations, engine ships, and aircraft.

This topic pertains to the operating method of a universal propeller, which utilizes a novel gearwheel arranged rotor blade that is directly operatively connected to a reference gearwheel. The timing gear and operatively connected hub gear senses processes the angular velocity, and the rotational movement of the hub gear follows the angular velocity of the reference gearwheel. The invention is particularly suitable for use in wind power installations, hydropower installations, engine ships, and aircraft.

Name: 92_uav_aerial_unmanned_wing
Representative_Docs: "A hybrid unmanned aerial vehicle utilizing solar energy and hydrogen energy for long-endurance flight, with distributed solar wings, a body power tail wing design, and a high-specific-energy energy storage battery."

This topic refers to the invention of an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) that is powered by hydrogen and has long endurance. The UAV has wing groups, equipment cabins, and a flight cabin, and is designed to be symmetrically arranged with respect to the wing. The UAV also includes pressure regulation groups, equipment cabins, and hydrogen storage pressure containers for storing and generating hydrogen energy. The UAV is capable of storing a larger quantity of hydrogen for longer periods of time, meeting the requirements of a long-range unmanned aerial vehicle. Additionally, the pressure regulation equipment cabin and the hydrogen energy supply arrangement help to maintain the internal pressure of the UAV, promoting adaptability in flight, and can be helpful for stable landing in low-temperature environments near space.

This topic refers to the invention of a long-range unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) that is powered by hydrogen. The UAV has wing groups, equipment cabins, and a flight cabin, and is particularly designed for endurance. The onboard equipment includes pressure regulation groups, which regulate the pressure inside the cabins, and hydrogen energy supply arrangements, which provide hydrogen fuel for the UAV. The hydrogen storage pressure container is used to store hydrogen and generate oxygen, which is then used to support the flight of the UAV. The UAV is equipped with airborne equipment cabins that help maintain stability in low-temperature environments near space. The larger storage capacity and specific capacity meet the requirements of unmanned aerial vehicles and provide extra buoyancy to help the UAV stable land.

Name: 93_advertising_azobenzenegraphene_exhaust_attention
Representative_Docs: The topic is related to the invention of a method for quickly activating hydrogen energy fuel cells. The method disclosed consists of a series of steps that aim to improve the performance and efficiency of the fuel cell stack. These steps include exhausting the primary gas, determining the activation process performance, reducing the exhaust time interval, setting the highest exhaust time, and carrying out exhaust treatment timing with the use of an electromagnetic valve. The method also takes into consideration factors such as the moisture content of the anode, the guaranteed condition of the film dryness, and the prevention of flooding during operation. The goal of this method is to stably operate the fuel cell under various conditions, including low environmental humidity and high fault tolerance, while reducing unnecessary waste and hydrogen.

The topic is related to the invention of a method for quickly activating a hydrogen energy fuel cell, which disclosed a set of steps for exhausting primary gas, activation process, and performance of a fuel cell stack. The method aims to reduce the exhaust time interval, while maintaining the highest exhaust time, reducing set exhaust time, and carrying out exhaust treatment timing with an electromagnetic valve. The performance of the fuel cell is improved by reducing the exhaust time and reducing unnecessary waste of hydrogen. The method also ensures stably operating conditions, guaranteed condition of the anode, and film dryness. It is suitable for operation in environments with low environmental humidity and high fault tolerance compared to constant-time exhaust. The methodsolves flooding problems caused by moisture content and drying issues in fuel cell operation processes.

The topic is about a method for quickly activating hydrogen energy fuel cells, which consists of several steps. The method involves exhausting the primary gas with a certain time interval, activation process, performance fuel cell stack setting, and exhaust time control using an electromagnetic valve. The aim is to reduce the exhaust time and achieve higher performance fuel cell while maintaining the moisture content and anode guaranteed condition. The method also includes reducing unnecessary waste hydrogen and providing great fault tolerance compared to constant-time exhaust. The topic is relevant to flooding film drying problems in fuel cell operation and stably operating under low environmental humidity conditions.

Name: 94_speed_regulator_hydropower_station
Representative_Docs: This topic pertains to the optimization control method and system for a hydropower station with one pipe and multiple machines. The hydropower station comprises a coupling shafting, multidimensional vibration, nonlinear mathematical model, gridconnected operation speed regulation, and mathematical model. The system establishes a multi-objective optimization function, considering adjustment performance, speed regulation, multidimensional vibration, dynamic performance, shafting selection, and disturbance load distribution coefficients. The speed regulator control parameters unit optimizes decision variables and utilizes a multi-objective optimization algorithm to obtain various pareto control schemes meeting the requirements. The invention establishes a model theoretical basis for safe and stable regulation optimization operation of the hydropower station.

This topic describes an innovative method and system for optimizing the operation of a hydropower station with multiple machines connected through one pipe. The system comprises several key components, including a nonlinear mathematical model for gridconnected operation, a unit for establishing a multi-objective optimization function, and a speed regulator with control parameters optimized for the specific operation. The method utilizes multi-objective optimization algorithms to obtain various pareto control schemes, ensuring safe and stable regulation of the operation of the hydropower station. The theoretical basis for this method is established on the common tube multimachine gridconnected operation, taking into consideration the dynamic performance and shafting speed regulation.

This topic is about a method and system for optimizing the operation of a hydropower station with one pipe and multiple machines. The hydropower station comprises a coupling shafting, multidimensional vibration, nonlinear mathematical model, gridconnected operation speed regulation, mathematical model, and a unit for establishing a multi-objective optimization function. The system takes into consideration the adjustment performance speed regulation, multidimensional vibration, dynamic performance of the shafting, and disturbance load distribution coefficients. The speed regulator control parameters unit optimizes the decision variables and utilizes a multi-objective optimization algorithm to obtain various pareto control schemes that meet the requirements. The invention establishes a theoretical basis for safe and stable regulation optimization operation of the hydropower station.

Name: 95_liquor_feed_gel_distillation
Representative_Docs: This topic describes an invention related to solar-powered distillation assembly, which continuously evaporates feed liquor using solar energy and efficient heat recovery. The assembly comprises a container containing feed liquor, a distillate collected container, a thermal contact compressor, and a negative pressure distillate container. The vapour produced from boiling the feed liquor is compressed by the compressor, and the condensed vapour is then entrained into the feed liquor using thermal energy returned from the distillate container. This process is designed to aid in the continuous distillation of feed liquor, making it more efficient and environmentally friendly.

This topic description is about a Solarpowered continuous distillation assembly with an efficient heat recovery invention. It involves a distillation assembly aid that continuously evaporates feed liquor using solar energy. The assembly comprises a container that contains the feed liquor, which is then evaporated using the thermal contact compressor. The vapour produced is then compressed, and the condensed vapour is used to enthalpy thermal energy and returned to the feed liquor. This process also involves the use of negative pressure in the distillate container, which helps to enhance the efficiency of the heat recovery invention.

This topic describes an invention related to solar-powered distillation assembly with efficient heat recovery. It involves a continuous distillation assembly aid that continuously evaporates feed liquor using solar energy, with efficient heat recovery. The assembly consists of a container containing feed liquor, a thermal contact compressor that compresses the vapour produced from boiling the feed liquor using solar energy or negative pressure, and a distillate container where the vapour is condensed, resulting in evaporation and the return of thermal energy.

Name: 96_cleaning_mechanism_rainwater_photovoltaic
Representative_Docs: This topic describes an invention for a adjustable photovoltaic support frame cleaning mechanism, which is related to the technical field of photovoltaics. The mechanism comprises a main body mechanism, cleaning mechanism, and plates supporting the tops. The cleaning mechanism includes a rotating rod, electric push rod, and cleaning mechanism arranged on the mounting blocks. The mounting blocks can be adjusted in inclination angle and overall height, allowing for the cleaning of the photovoltaic panel in a non-contact manner. The cleaning process also includes avoiding damage to the surface of the photovoltaic panel and preventing dust accumulation.

The topic is related to the field of photovoltaics and describes an invention of an adjustable photovoltaic support frame cleaning mechanism. The mechanism comprises a main body mechanism that includes plates supporting the tops of the plates, respectively, and a cleaning mechanism main body mechanism that comprises a cleaning mechanism with rotating rods, electric push rods, and cleaning mechanism arranged mounting blocks. The mounting blocks are provided with an inclination angle and overall height, and the cleaning mechanism is designed to change the adjustment mechanism according to the installation condition field. The mechanism can clean the photovoltaic panel in a non-contact manner, avoiding damage to the surface of the panel and dust accumulation during the cleaning process.

The topic is related to the field of photovoltaics and discloses an adjustable photovoltaic support frame cleaning mechanism. It consists of a main body mechanism that comprises plates supporting the tops and bottoms, respectively, and a cleaning mechanism main body mechanism. Name: 97_hydrogel_polyacrylic_nanotube_acid
Representative_Docs: This topic describes a method for preparing carbon nanotube-polyacrylic acid hydrogel products, which can be applied in various applications. The process involves氧化碳纳米管、 perform in-situ polymerization of acrylic acid, sodium hydroxide, ammonium persulfate, triethanolamine, and N-methylenebisacrylamide to obtain a carbon nanotube-polyacrylic acid hydrogel with a uniform porous structure, which facilitates rapid water supply and efficient photothermal conversion. The hydrogel can be attached to a sponge base to form a solar-powered carbon nanotube-polyacrylic acid hydrogel steam generator for solar seawater desalination, improving evaporation rate and efficiency. The advantages of this method include energy conservation, environmental protection, simplicity, and practicality.

Name: 98_membrane_complementary_scheduling_freezer
Representative_Docs: This topic describes a novel method for preparing a hydrophobic modified membrane based on multi-effect heat energy conversion, including the steps of dispersing surfacecarboxylated carbon nanotubes, applying the dispersion on a PVDF membrane, drying the membrane, and subjecting it to mechanical hot pressing to form a high-robustness functional membrane. The resulting membrane is then placed in an alkane solution containing a silane coupling agent and removed after drying. The invention aims to develop a multieffect heat energy conversion based solar heat conversion, which reduces evaporation and landfill leachate membrane concentrated solution. This provides a rational, feasible, efficient, and economic technical path for green sustainable solar energy production.

The present invention aims to develop a multieffect heat energy conversion-based solar heat conversion system that utilizes the evaporation reduction and landfill leachate membrane concentrated solution driven by green sustainable solar energy, providing a rational, feasible, efficient, and economic technical path for current membrane concentrated solution reduction.

Name: 100_segment_mast_lifting_mechanical
Representative_Docs: The topic describes an invention related to wind energy storage, specifically focusing on the process of storing wind energy in the form of potential energy within a wind turbine. The wind turbine consists of a mast, drive train, electric generator, and rotor blades. The drive train is connected to the generator, which converts the mechanical energy into electrical energy to be fed into the electrical grid. The transmission mechanism is operatively connected to the mechanical means, such as a lifting segment, which is driven by the prime mover (wind turbine). The lifting segment is fixed to the base segment and is displaced vertically, with the lifting axis relative to the base segment. The lifting way is possible, and the mechanical energy drive train is stored in the form of potential energy within the lifting segment. When released, the potential energy is converted into mechanical energy to drive the wind turbine.

The topic is about a wind turbine invention that relates to storing wind energy from potential energy. It involves a wind turbine having a mast, drive train, electric generator connected to the drive train, means shaft, driven rotor blades, and other components. The wind turbine is characterized by a fixed mast, base segment, lifting segment, and potential energy storage. The lifting segment is displaced vertically and operates to store mechanical energy in the form of potential energy. When released, the potential energy is converted into electrical energy and fed into the generator, which is connected to the electrical grid. The drive train transmission mechanism is operatively connected to the mechanical means, lifting segment, and prime mover, allowing for the efficient conversion of mechanical energy into electrical energy.

This topic describes an invention related to wind energy storage using a wind turbine with a potential energy form. The wind turbine has a mast, drive train, electric generator connected to the drive train, and rotor blades. The mechanical energy from the drive train is converted into electrical energy by the generator, which is fed into the electrical grid. The wind turbine is characterized by a fixed mast, a base segment with a lifting segment displaced vertically, and a lifting axis relative to the base segment. The lifting segment is operatively connected to the mechanical means, which operates a driven machine, such as a wind turbine with prime mover. The wind turbine is designed to store form potential energy in the lifting segment and release it as needed.

Name: 101_pvt_air_panels_io
Representative_Docs: The topic is about improving the efficiency of solar panels by using a photovoltaic thermal (PVT) apparatus that combines photovoltaic panels and solar air heaters. The PVT apparatus has a hollow interior with hollow interior defining ducts for air transfer and heat underside PV panel space injection ports for discharge port. The air handling unit (AHU) pushes ambient air inlet, and the warm air flows away are combined with the escape of ambient exhaust for combined heat transfer storage unit. The PVT sheet transfers interior space colder environmental conditions, and PVT equipment radiate heat return cooled air space. Additionally, the Topic also covers the collection and cooling of water tanks in industrial processes.

It combines photovoltaic panels and solar air heaters, which have a hollow interior with ducts for air transfer and heat underside. The PV panel space injection ports provide a discharge port for warm air flow away, and the fan pushes ambient air inlet. The air handling unit (AHU) returns warm air flows, and the combined heat transfer storage unit determines the air temperature. The PVT sheet transfers interior space colder, and the equipment radiate heat return cooled air space. The topic also includes condensate heating and cooling water tanks in industrial processes.

Name: 102_charging_interface_module_snowflake
Representative_Docs: The topic is about a charging module and system application, which provides charging functionality. The charging module comprises a direct current (DC) charging module, a functional interface, an inverter control guiding module, and a photovoltaic (PV) interface. The functional interface includes a charging module for receiving power from a LED photovoltaic module, which converts solar energy into direct current charging. The direct current charging module is used to receive power from the solar energy module and charge an electric automobile. The OBC (On-Board Controller) adopts a direct current charge system for electric automobiles, providing a charging module with limited charging power. This improves the charging speed and actual power charging for the electric automobile, like the energy module charging received solar energy conversion.

The charging speed is improved, and the actual power charging of the electric automobile is achieved.

Name: 103_microporous_conjugated_polymer_battery
Representative_Docs: This topic describes a novel method for preparing photothermal materials, specifically a composite aerogel made of polypyrrole modified carboxymethyl cellulosesulfonated conjugated microporous polymer. The preparation process involves four steps: 1) preparing a conjugated microporous polymer, 2) preparing a sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer, 3) preparing a carboxymethyl cellulose sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer composite aerogel, and 4) preparing a polypyrrole modified carboxymethyl cellulose sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer composite aerogel. This material has excellent photothermal performance, high solar energy conversion efficiency, excellent salt resistance, and antifouling properties. It has potential applications in seawater desalination, containing heavy metal ions, and dye wastewater purification. The future of this technology lies in its practical applications in these areas.

This topic describes an invention related to the preparation method and application of a photothermal material called "polypyrrole modified carboxymethyl cellulosesulfonated conjugated microporous polymer composite aerogel." The material is prepared through a series of steps, including the preparation of a conjugated microporous polymer, sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer, carboxymethyl cellulose sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer composite aerogel, and finally, the preparation of a polypyrrole modified carboxymethyl cellulose sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer aerogel photothermal material. This material has several unique features, such as high solar energy conversion efficiency, excellent salt resistance, and antifouling performance, making it valuable for practical applications in areas such as sea water desalination and wastewater purification treatment. The invention is expected to have a promising future in the field of photothermal materials.

This topic relates to the invention of a photothermal material preparation method, specifically involving the use of polypyrrole modified carboxymethyl cellulosesulfonated conjugated microporous polymer composite aerogel. The preparation process consists of several steps, including preparing conjugated microporous polymer, sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer, preparing carboxymethyl cellulose sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer composite aerogel, and preparing polypyrrole modified carboxymethyl cellulose sulfonated conjugated microporous polymer composite aerogel. This material is capable of efficiently generating solar steam, resulting in higher solar energy conversion efficiency, excellent salt resistance, and antifouling performance. It also has practical application value and potential for future use in sea water desalination and treatment of dyes and wastewater.

Name: 104_arrangement_arrangements_housing_stored
Representative_Docs: The topic is about systems for storing energy, specifically focusing on the conversion of solar energy into electrical energy using photovoltaic arrangements. The system includes a battery arrangement for storing the energy, a switching arrangement for managing the power output, and a power management arrangement for regulating the stored energy. The topic also includes an apparatus housing that houses these components.

The topic is about a stored energy power system that comprises a photovoltaic arrangement for converting solar energy into electrical energy, a battery arrangement for storing the electrical energy, a switching arrangement for managing the power output, and a power management arrangement apparatus with a housing for storing the stored energy power system.

The topic is about energy storage systems that use stored energy to provide power. The system comprises a photovoltaic arrangement to convert solar energy into electrical energy, a battery arrangement for storing the energy, a switching arrangement for managing the power output, and a power management arrangement for regulating the stored energy. The energy storage system also includes an apparatus housing to house the components.
